description: From Middle English enjoyen, from Old French enjoier, anjoier, enjoer (“to give joy, receive with joy, rejoice”), equivalent to en- +‎ joy.

verbs.description: enjoy (third-person singular simple present enjoys, present participle enjoying, simple past and past participle enjoyed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To receive pleasure or satisfaction from something.
examples: Enjoy your holidays!   I enjoy dancing.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To have the use or benefit of something.
examples: that the children of Israel may enjoy every man the inheritance of his fathers

entries.meaning: (intransitive, India) To be satisfied or receive pleasure.
